question.title: You have a question about the tool

firstpart.info: Class II-A medical device currently undergoing clinical validation

secondpart.title: How is depression linked to sedentariness?

text: Sedentariness corresponds to a wakeful situation of sitting or lying down characterized by low energy expenditure. Digital sedentariness includes time spent on smartphones, computers, or in front of the television.
According to the World Health Organization, it would be possible to stem in Europe
year if one could fight against
is one of the best endogenous ways to produce
two neurotransmitters that help improve the condition of patients with depression.

thirdpart.title: Digital therapeutic support for everyday life

first.title: CUSTOMIZED PHYSICAL EXERCISES
first.text: The medical device offers physical exercises validated by smartphone sensors and that follow the recommendations of the High Authority of Health.

second.title: REMOTE MEDICAL MONITORING
second.text: The doctor ensures remote monitoring of the patient. They send congratulations for progress made and offer support in case of regression.

third.title: SCREEN MANAGEMENT
third.text: The medical device moderates applications and websites that can be detrimental to the patient's health. The device is cross-platform: it can be installed on all of the patient's screens.

fourth.title: PERSONALIZED ADVICE
fourth.text: On a daily basis, the patient benefits from personalized advice to limit depressive symptoms and sedentary behavior.

fourthpart.title: A multidisciplinary scientific team
text: is the result of a meeting between the world of research in
Concerned with the problem of screens associated with depression, our team has dedicated the last four years to developing a solution aimed at improving the quality of life of these individuals.
allows us to grasp the complexity of mental pathologies in an innovative way:
list: Islam EL BOUDI, expert in digital biomarkers
Dr. Mathilde RIANT, expert in motivational processes
Dr. Nicolas VUILLERME, expert in e-health

fifthpart.title: Why use our medical device?
text: Sedentariness greater than 2 hours / day increases the risk of depression by 38 to 46%
of patients who cannot benefit from traditional care and to
after leaving support due to environmental factors of sedentariness.
In France, there are high waiting times in Psychological Medical Centers and Hospitals with a psychiatry service
The average waiting time for outpatient care for adults is 1 to 4 months in 53% of establishments and 5 months to 1 year for children and adolescents in 45% of establishments
Despite the growing number of treatments against depression:
Persistence of the depressive episode despite at least two successive antidepressant treatments in a third of cases
Risk of relapse despite remission after treatment:
33% of patients experience a relapse after cognitive-behavioral psychotherapy
and 14.4% after 4 months of remission following pharmacological treatment

sixthpart.title: Our clinical pathway
sixthpart.subtitle: Discover all the stages of validation of our medical device...

E.title: We will ask you questions about your child and at the end you will get a score on their screen addiction.

Questions.0: Is he/she preoccupied with screens (thinking about their last use or anticipating the next one) ?
Questions.1: Does he/she need to use screens for increasingly longer periods of time to achieve satisfaction ?
Questions.2: Does he/she feel restless, moody, depressed, or irritable when trying to limit or stop their screen use ?
Questions.3: Has he/she tried unsuccessfully to control, limit, or stop their screen use ?
Questions.4: Does he/she use screens as a means of escaping problems or to relieve mood disorders (feelings of helplessness, guilt, anxiety, depression) ?

E.emailTitle: Enter your email and receive your score instantly.
E.successMessage: Perfect, we have just sent the email with your child's score.

eighthPart.title: Contacts
eighthPart.subtitle: Would you like to receive the latest information on our scientific work?
eighthPart.text1: Sign up to our mailing list:

A.subhead: Automatically sets up parental controls. Offers challenges to unlock video games and social networks.

firstPart.title: Scientifically validated parental control
firstPart.text: is an application resulting from a 3-year research project at the University of Grenoble Alpes. The team is composed of psychologists, researchers, doctors, and engineers in order to build the application based on
firstPart.text2: results obtained through collaboration with the Rectorate and the University. Our mission is to provide adolescents with the necessary tools to navigate
firstPart.text4: in the digital world and to free themselves from omnipresent algorithmic influences.

secondPart.title: How does it work?
secondPart.firstText: Download the smartphone application and scan all of your child's devices (tablet, computer, video game console).
secondPart.secondText: Let our artificial intelligence find the best settings for your child: categories of sites and applications to block, screen cutoff time, maximum entertainment time per day.
secondPart.thirdText: Congratulations! Your child is now protected from inappropriate content. Challenges will be offered to unlock the applications you have configured.
secondPart.fourthText: is an innovative tool designed to help overcome screen addiction. With the strong presence of screens in our daily lives, whether for work, communication, or entertainment, it has become crucial to maintain a healthy digital lifestyle. By offering challenges outside of screens, the application's restrictions adapt to your child's progress! The more he learns to self-regulate, the less restrictive the application becomes.

1.name: Julien's mom, 9 years old
1.text: Thanks to the application, Julien uses his phone much less and remembers to do his homework before going on his screens.

2.name: Thomas's dad, 13 years old
2.text: Thomas is becoming more and more active and loves the outdoor challenges offered by the application.

3.name: Ilyes's mom, 11 years old
3.text: With the restriction modes, Phonix Health controls the categories of applications to be blocked for Ilyes based on his usage.

4.name: Clément's dad, 14 years old
4.text: By completing challenges, Clément becomes more and more independent and, above all, less closed off from those around him.

card.first: Phonix Health helps you to find a better digital lifestyle.

landing.videoSourceText: Video source: Lumni -Screen addiction: who gets us hooked and how do we quit ?

firstPart.title: Why is it important to know how to manage your screen time ?

secondPart.title: help you find time away from the screen ?
secondPart.text1: is an innovative tool designed to help repair screen addiction. With the strong presence of screens in our daily lives, whether for work, communication or entertainment, it has become crucial to maintain a healthy digital lifestyle.
secondPart.text2: is The ideal solution for platforms, whether on the phone, tablet, computer, television or consoles, to find a balanced use of screens.

thirdPart.title: What is screen addiction ?
thirdPart.text: Although the term screen addiction is still debated in the research community, it has been established that spending a lot of time in front of screens can have a direct cause on sedentary lifestyle, depression and a lower quality of sleep. Several questionnaires have been developed to diagnose screen addiction.
thirdPart.text1: You can take this screen addiction questionnaire yourself by clicking on this link:

radarChart.title: Impact of Screens on Health
radarChart.analyzeText: According to our analysis, your screen usage is primarily correlated with a high score in:
radarChart.adviceText: Intensive screen usage can be correlated with an anxio-depressive score due to various factors. Social media and online gaming can create an environment of constant social comparison, generating feelings of dissatisfaction and inadequacy, which can worsen anxiety and depression. The impact on sleep is also a key factor as screen usage before bedtime disrupts the production of melatonin, promoting insomnia and sleep problems, which are often linked to anxio-depressive disorders. Additionally, the sedentary lifestyle associated with excessive screen use and relying on screens as an escape can also worsen anxious and depressive symptoms. The therapy you will undergo will help you find a healthy balance in your screen usage and take care of your mental and emotional well-being by diversifying your activities and promoting real social interactions.
